data.sampled:
Of course! The ROT13, also known as the Caesar cipher, is a simple type of encryption that involves reversing the letters of a message. Here's how you can encrypt the string 'Gur gnyragrq qnapre zbirq tenprshyyl npebff gur fgntr, pncgvingvat gurnhqvrapr jvgu rirel fgrc.' using the ROT13 cipher:

'GUR GNYRAGR QNAPRE ZBIR TENPRSHYYL NPEBFF GUR FGNTR, PNC GVNGVAT GURNHQVR AJVGU RIREL FGRC.'

The recipient can then easily unlock the message by applying the same algorithm in reverse.
